Detailed Description

This file contains the implementation of the APIs present in the device abstraction layer file of RTI. This also contains some related macros.

Function Documentation

void RTIDwwdClearStatus ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  status 
)

Clear DWWD status.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the RTI instance.
statusViolation status to clear. Values given by bitwise or of enum rtiDwwdStatus_t
Returns
None.
void RTIDwwdCounterEnable ( uint32_t  baseAddr)

Enable DWWD down counter.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the RTI instance.
Returns
None.
Note
This API should be called after configuration of DWWD Window.

Returns

uint32_t RTIDwwdGetStatus ( uint32_t  baseAddr)

Get DWWD status.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the RTI instance.
Returns
DWWD status DWWD status. Refer enum rtiDwwdStatus_t for possible bitwise or of all return values.
uint32_t RTIDwwdGetTicksToOpenWindow ( uint32_t  baseAddr)

This API returns the number of clock cycles of RTI clock remaining for the Window to Open.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the RTI instance.
Returns
Clock cycles Clock cycles remaining for Open Window. Returns '0' if Window is already Open.
Note
Number of clock cycles returned by this API may differ from actual clock cycles needed for Window to open, User should also check if window is open or not before doing any further operation. For this purpose user can use RTIDwwdIsClosedWindow() API.
uint32_t RTIDwwdGetTimeOut ( uint32_t  baseAddr)

This API will return current configured time out (number of clock cycles of RTI clock) value.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the RTI instance.
Returns
time-out Configured time out value.
uint32_t RTIDwwdGetWindowSize ( uint32_t  baseAddr)

This API will return current configured Window Size.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the RTI instance.
Returns
Window Size Configured Window Size. Refer enum rtiDwwdWindowSize_t
uint32_t RTIDwwdIsClosedWindow ( uint32_t  baseAddr)

Check for Closed Window.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the RTI instance.
Returns
status Closed Window Status TRUE if Window is Closed. FALSE if Window is Open.
uint32_t RTIDwwdIsCounterEnabled ( uint32_t  baseAddr)

Check if DWWD down counter was enabled.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the RTI instance.
Returns
status TRUE if counter is enabled. FALSE if counter is not enabled.
Note
This API should be called after configuration of DWWD Window.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the RTI instance.
Returns
None.
int32_t RTIDwwdSetPreload ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  dwwdPreloadVal 
)

Set DWWD preload value. From this value down counter starts down counting.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the RTI instance.
dwwdPreloadDown counter preload value. Refer DWWD Down Counter Overview.
Returns
status Success of DWWD preload value setting.
void RTIDwwdSetReaction ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  dwwdReaction 
)

Set DWWD reaction.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the RTI instance.
dwwdReactionDWWD reaction for violation/expiration. Values given by enum rtiDwwdReaction_t
Returns
None.
Note
: 1. DWWD need to be serviced if Reaction is changed when DWWD is enabled and Window is Open,to take immediate effect. If not serviced, DWWD will generated previously configured Reaction irrespective of current configuration.
  1. If DWWD is enabled and Window is Close then any change in Reaction will take immediate effect. DWWD need not to be serviced in this case.
void RTIDwwdSetWindowSize ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  dwwdWindowSize 
)

Set DWWD Window Size.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the RTI instance.
dwwdWindowSizeDWWD Window Size. Values given by enum rtiDwwdWindowSize_t
Returns
None.
Note
: 1. DWWD need to be serviced if Window Size is changed when DWWD is enabled and Window is Open,to take immediate effect. If not serviced, DWWD Window Size will not be changed irrespective of current configuration.
  1. If DWWD is enabled and Window is Close then any change in Window Size will take immediate effect. DWWD need not to be serviced in this case.
int32_t RTIDwwdWindowConfig ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  dwwdReaction,
uint32_t  dwwdPreloadVal,
uint32_t  dwwdWindowSize 
)

Configure DWWD before enabling.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the RTI instance.
dwwdReactionDWWD reaction for violation/expiration. Values given by enum rtiDwwdReaction_t
dwwdPreloadValDown counter preload value. This preload value is time-out period in terms of number of clock cycles of RTI clock source. This is 25 bit value in the range 0x1FFFU to 0x1FFFFFFU.
  • Refer DWWD Down Counter Overview.
dwwdWindowSizeDWWD window size Values given by enum rtiDwwdWindowSize_t
Returns
status Success of the window configuration
uint32_t RTIIsDwwdKeySequenceCorrect ( uint32_t  baseAddr)

Check for correct sequence write to DWWD key Register.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the RTI instance.
Returns
status RTI key sequence status.
